item.title: About
item.description: About Us The UCSB Game Development Club (GDC) is… TODO Club Officers <div class="officer-info-desc"> Jake is the club&rsquo;s co-chair with Chelsea. Artist into visual design, fictional narrative, personal narrative work, and sociological and feminist theories’ intersections within art, games, culture, and activism. <div class="officer-info-desc"> Chelsea is the club’s co-chair and Art Specialist in 2D concept and character art with some experience in 3D modeling. She’s interested in narratively driven games with wholesome messages and a sense of humor.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Resources This page contains a list of helpful resources for game development. <h3>Beginner Friendly</h3> <p>These programs can be learned quickly and are easy to use, but they are limited in what they can do.</p> <ul> <li> <a href="https://www.construct.net/en">Construct 3</a> <li> <a href="https://www.yoyogames.com/gamemaker">Game Maker Studio</a> <li> RPG Maker (Often goes on sale on Humble Bundle) <li> Scratch <li> <a href="https://ledoux.itch.io/bitsy">Bitsy</a> </ul> <h3>Story Focused</h3> <p>These programs are good for creating narratives and story based games without too much coding.
